exclusion:
EXCLUDING the device from Z-Wave network:

  1. Set the controller into EXCLUSION mode. Follow instructions provided by controller manufacturer.
  2. Press the key on the panel 3 times in quick succession (within approx 1.5sec).

Note: Check the controller or gateway to see whether exclusion is successful. The exclusion will delete all association data.
inclusion:
INCLUDING the device into Z-Wave network:

  1. Set the controller into INCLUSION mode. Follow instructions provided by controller manufacturer.
  2. Press the key on the panel 3 times in quick succession (within approx 1.5sec).

Note: Check the controller or gateway to see whether inclusion is successful.
label: MH-P311

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: State Saved?
parameters.description: Dimmer state saved or not when power down
parameters.overview:
0x00 not saved，Dimmer will be off

when powered again

0x01 saved，Dimmer will keep the same

state when powered again

parameters.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameters.overview:
0x00 forbid ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF

0x01 forbid ALL ON, allow ALL OFF

0x02 allow ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF

0xFF allow ALL ON, allow ALL OFF

parameters.label: Minimum brightness level
parameters.overview:
1~98 percentage brightness level

The max level should always higher than min level

parameters.label: Maximum brightness level
parameters.overview:
2~99 percentage brightness level

The max level should always higher than min level

parameters.label: Single dimming step time(Manual)
parameters.overview:
Max 2.55s, in 10ms steps

Manual control realized by holding external 8 button

parameters.label: Single dimming step time (Auto)
parameters.overview:
Max 2.55s, in 10ms steps

Auto control

realized by:

- one click;

- double click of

external button;

- send Z-Wave CC

parameters.label: Single dimming step size (Auto)
parameters.overview:
Auto control

realized by:

- one click;

- double click of

external button;

- send Z-Wave CC

parameters.label: One click of S1
parameters.overview:
0x00 switch between Off and last saved

brightness level

1~99 percentage value

switch between Off and the set value

parameters.label: Double click of S1
parameters.overview:
0x00 function disabled

0x01 reach max brightness level

parameters.label: Switch1 to Association Group 2 & 3
parameters.description: Operation report from Switch1 to Association Group 2 & 3
parameters.overview:
bit 6:0

0x00 report all operation to AG2&3

0x01 only report when switching OFF

0x02 only report when switching ON

bit7 (valid for AG3 during dimming only)

0 not report during dimming

1 report during dimming

parameters.label: Switch1 to Association Group 2
parameters.description: Operation report from Switch1 to Association Group 2
parameters.overview:
0x00 When sent Basic Set On,

carried Value is 0xFF

0x01 When sent Basic Set On, carried

Value is Current Dimmer Value

parameters.label: Scene ID sent to AG1 when one click of S1
parameters.description: Scene ID sent to AG1 when one click of S1
parameters.overview:
0 Scene Activation disabled

1~255 send Activation CC to AG1 with

specified Scene ID

parameters.label: Scene ID sent to AG1 when double click of S1
parameters.description: Scene ID sent to AG1 when double click of S1
parameters.overview:
0 Scene Activation disabled

1~255 send Activation CC to AG1 with

specified Scene ID

parameters.label: Scene ID sent to AG1 when hold S1
parameters.description: Scene ID sent to AG1 when hold S1
parameters.overview:
0 Scene Activation disabled

1~255 send Activation CC to AG1 with

specified Scene ID

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: 1st AG: reports device’s dimming state. It supports only one Node ID. A controller/gateway SHOULD be associated to this AG.

associations.label: Basic Set Command
associations.overview: 2nd AG: to control the associated devices synchronously. When S1’s state changes, it will send “Basic Set Command” to these devices. It supports upto 5 Node IDs.

associations.label: Multi-level Set Command
associations.overview:
AG: to control the associated devices synchronously. When S1’s state changes, it will send

“Multi-level Set Command” to these devices. It supports upto 5 Node IDs.
